title: Account Management test 3/3
description: Knowledge test for newly-hired Account Managers - to be passed after 4th week at Netguru - after PM shadowing (as stated in the Mentoring Checklist)

published_attributes.title: Knowledge test for newly-hired Account Managers - to be passed after 4th week at Netguru
published_attributes.serialized_body:
The test will check your knowledge from the Mentoring Checklist materials added until the end of week 4 and after PM shadowing. You need 80% to pass! Good luck!

More than one answer per question could be applicable!

blocks.text: The test will check your knowledge from the Mentoring Checklist materials added until the end of week 4 and after PM shadowing. You need 80% to pass! Good luck!

answers.body: SOW is not needed - MSA is enough

answers.body: SOW is not needed - MSA is enough

draft_attributes.title: When SOW should be signed?

answers.body: PMs and AMs should sync regularly
In case of fires, PMs and AMs should sync as often as needed
Only AM prepares agenda & strategy for the fire call with the client
Risks should be escalated and raised on the biz channel
AARs shouldn’t be done after managing the fire

answers.body: PMs and AMs should sync regularly
In case of fires, PMs and AMs should sync as often as needed
Only AM prepares agenda & strategy for the fire call with the client
Risks should be escalated and raised on the biz channel
AARs shouldn’t be done after managing the fire

answers.body: Contact the client regularly to maintain the relationship
Prepare and discuss the maintenance offer for the client
Conduct an end-of-the-project AAR meeting and publish the results at Confluence
If client decides not to work with us anymore, make sure to let the client know that Netguru is their point of contact for the future

published_attributes.title: What should AMs do in the post project phase? Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Contact the client regularly to maintain the relationship
Prepare and discuss the maintenance offer for the client
Conduct an end-of-the-project AAR meeting and publish the results at Confluence
If client decides not to work with us anymore, make sure to let the client know that Netguru is their point of contact for the future

draft_attributes.title: What should AMs do in the post project phase? Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Sticking to Netguru rules only, not letting own adjustments

answers.body: Nothing - it’s PM’s job to take care of everything that’s related to the promotion
Communicate to the client that the promotion has taken place
Keep the rates at the original level since that’s what have been established in SOW
Rise the rates after 3-6 months depending on how long the developer have been working in the project
Rotate the developer for a one with lower position if the client doesn’t want to pay increased salary
Never mention the promotion to the client

published_attributes.title: What should AMs do if a team member gets promoted? Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Nothing - it’s PM’s job to take care of everything that’s related to the promotion
Communicate to the client that the promotion has taken place
Keep the rates at the original level since that’s what have been established in SOW
Rise the rates after 3-6 months depending on how long the developer have been working in the project
Rotate the developer for a one with lower position if the client doesn’t want to pay increased salary
Never mention the promotion to the client

published_attributes.title: How many hours a month of developers’ work are covered by the maintenance agreement?

draft_attributes.title: How many hours a month of developers’ work are covered by the maintenance agreement?

answers.body: The hours from next months are taken
The client should pay for the extra hours used as stated in the contract
Nothing - it’s our favour to the client
It’s not possible to use more time than established in the contract

published_attributes.title: What happens if the client uses more hours than set by the maintenance contract - by default?

answers.body: The hours from next months are taken
The client should pay for the extra hours used as stated in the contract
Nothing - it’s our favour to the client
It’s not possible to use more time than established in the contract

draft_attributes.title: What happens if the client uses more hours than set by the maintenance contract - by default?

answers.body: Unused hours can be spent within the same quarter (counted from the beginning of the contract) and are lost if the quarter finishes
Unused hours sum up and might be used whenever the client wants

published_attributes.title: What happens if the client within a specific month doesn’t use all of the hours from the maintenance contract?

answers.body: Unused hours can be spent within the same quarter (counted from the beginning of the contract) and are lost if the quarter finishes
Unused hours sum up and might be used whenever the client wants

draft_attributes.title: What happens if the client within a specific month doesn’t use all of the hours from the maintenance contract?

answers.body: Maintenance contracts always have a termination date
As a standard, they are an ongoing commitment
If a client wants to terminate, he’s obliged to do it at least with 30 days notice period

published_attributes.title: Choose the correct answer/s referring to the maintenance contract.  Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Maintenance contracts always have a termination date
As a standard, they are an ongoing commitment
If a client wants to terminate, he’s obliged to do it at least with 30 days notice period

draft_attributes.title: Choose the correct answer/s referring to the maintenance contract.  Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Estimations in the maintenance mode are free of charge as long as they take less than 30 minutes
Developers in Netguru may work on projects on the hourly/daily/monthly basis
Developers can work for the clients either full time, or within a maintenance contract
If a developer is new to the project, the maintenance set up is free of charge
Estimations are always free in the maintenance mode

published_attributes.title: Choose correct answers. Multiply answers may apply.

answers.body: Estimations in the maintenance mode are free of charge as long as they take less than 30 minutes
Developers in Netguru may work on projects on the hourly/daily/monthly basis
Developers can work for the clients either full time, or within a maintenance contract
If a developer is new to the project, the maintenance set up is free of charge
Estimations are always free in the maintenance mode
